intro: Dimeria hirtella, commonly known as the hairy dimeria, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and smartweeds. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically hairy, giving the plant its common name, and it often grows in rocky or sandy soils. Dimeria hirtella is adapted to arid environments and is considered a short-lived perennial.
